body:
conda env create -f deeplabcut.yaml

Note: you may need to restart the kernel to use updated packages.
'conda' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
I have reinstalled and selected the PATH option and checked them manually in advanced settings. Time elapsed with zero error messages has been 45minutes

You are running that in an ipython console. If spyder has a terminal or command line option, use that. Otherwise, just use the anaconda command line, started as an admin (as described in the installation instructions).

Ok thanks. I ran in anaconda command line  and this error was produced

Open the DEEPLABCUT.yaml file you downloaded in a text editor. Delete the single quotes around deeplabcut in the last line, save the file, and run the conda create command again.
You currently have:

```
- 'deeplabcut[gui]'==2.2rc3
```

Change that to:

```
- deeplabcut[gui]==2.2rc3
```
